content: AMA The Fifth Person Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 20 Feb 2019With the Budget 2019 just being released, are there any industries or companies that would be good to invest in this year?5 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (5)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Zann ChuaLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 20 Feb 2019Hello!This year's budget like every other year spends the most on defence so you can look towards the side of ST engineering as mentioned by the others. Also, there seems to be an increase in spending on ageing Singaporeans. Thus, can look towards the healthcare sector such as Raffles Medical Group and Thompson Medical Group. Pharmetical industries can also be another area of healthcare to look into. There are some areas that maybe affected with policies such as Duty Free International Ltd since the government is reducint duty free alcohol allowance as well as the decrease in GST relief for goods bought overseas. 0 comments3

Leonard TanLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 20 Feb 2019SG's main spending- our defence budget has risen to 30%. I would say look towards ST Electronics(parent company of ST Kinetics-which makes weapons for SAF)Merdeka Generation Package- albeit a policy largely similar to Pioneer Generation Package and some would say a pre-election bolster. I would say look at sectors that are to benefit from the increasing ageing population care and service- hospitals, pharmacuticals, physiology. Indirectly related is the call for healthier foods-one which I believe will benefit local food wholesalers whom are particularly most adapted to capitalizing on this trend.0 comments2

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 20 Feb 2019Like what the others said, you can consider the defence and healthcare sectors, as it looks like the government and singaporeans will be spending more on these 2 sextors respectively.0 comments0
Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 20 Feb 2019Definitely Defense and Medical industries0 comments0
Victor Chng, Co-Founder at Fifth Person Pte LtdLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 20 Feb 2019Hi, Based on the budget, it seem like the defense and healthcare sector may benefit from it. 0 comments0
